database.name: dbindex/9606/rna
database.detail: Human Genomic + transcript from NCBI

database.name: dbindex/10090/rna
database.detail: Mouse Genomic + transcript from NCBI

database.name: nr
database.detail: All GenBank+EMBL+DDBJ+PDB sequences (but no EST, STS, GSS, or phase 0, 1 or 2 HTGS sequences). No longer 'non-redundant' due to computational cost.

database.name: refseq_rna
database.detail: mRNA sequences from NCBI Reference Sequence Project.

database.name: refseq_genomic
database.detail: Genomic sequences from NCBI Reference Sequence Project.

database.name: chromosome
database.detail: Complete genomes and complete chromosomes from the NCBI Reference Sequence project. It overlaps with refseq_genomic.

database.name: est
database.detail: Database of GenBank + EMBL + DDBJ sequences from EST division.

database.name: est_human
database.detail: Human subset of EST.

database.name: est_mouse
database.detail: Mouse subset of EST

database.name: est_others
database.detail: Subset of est other than human or mouse.

database.name: gss
database.detail: Genome Survey Sequence, includes single-pass genomic data, nexon-trapped sequences, and Alu PCR sequences.

database.name: htgs
database.detail: Unfinished High Throughput Genomic Sequences: phases 0, 1 and 2. Finished, phase 3 HTG sequences are in nr.

database.name: pat
database.detail: Nucleotides from the Patent division of GenBank.

database.name: pdb
database.detail: Sequences derived from the 3-dimensional structure records from Protein Data Bank. They are NOT the coding sequences for the coresponding proteins found in the same PDB record.

database.name: alu
database.detail: Select Alu repeats from REPBASE, suitable for masking Alu repeats from query sequences. See 'Alu alert' by Claverie and Makalowski, Nature 371: 752 (1994).

database.name: dbsts
database.detail: Database of Sequence Tag Site entries from the STS division of GenBank + EMBL + DDBJ.

database.name: wgs
database.detail: Assemblies of Whole Genome Shotgun sequences.

database.name: env_nt
database.detail: Sequences from environmental samples, such as uncultured bacterial samples isolated from soil or marine samples. The largest single source is the Sagarsso Sea project. This does NOT overlap with nucleotide nr.

database.name: nr
database.detail: Non-redundant GenBank CDS translations + PDB + SwissProt + PIR + PRF, excluding those in env_nr.

database.name: refseq_protein
database.detail: Protein sequences from NCBI Reference Sequence project.

database.name: swissprot
database.detail: Last major release of the SWISS-PROT protein sequence database (no incremental updates).

database.name: pat
database.detail: Proteins from the Patent division of GenBank.

database.name: pdb
database.detail: Sequences derived from the 3-dimensional structure records from the Protein Data Bank.

database.name: env_nr
database.detail: Non-redundant CDS translations from env_nt entries.
